name: Antares Hotel Accademia

reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay for both work and pleasure at the hotel Accademia. The hotel is around a 10 minute scenic ride on the tram from the Duomo, and is facing the Portello shopping centre which has absolutely everything you want from high fashion and designer things, to more practical shops for everyday requirements. It seems that the managers concentrate on training their staff well as the service was excellent, and the rooms absolutely top notch and seemingly recently refurbished. After having completed my work requirements, my wife came out and we enjoyed Milano for the weekend. Had heard that it was not the primary tourist destination of Italy, but we found it very beautiful and thoroughly enjoyable! Great city centre, with shops bars and restaurants as well as the usual historical and architectural beauty Italy is famed for. It was even close enough to the San Siro Stadium for me to enjoy an Inter league game (while the wife busily completed her shopping extravaganza) before flying out late Sunday night.
reviews.title: Great Location - Stylish Hotel

likes.liked: — Great location - quality rooms and service

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for two nights at the end of April with some friends. The hotel is a bit of an eyesore from the outside, rooms are modern but a little gaudy with their bright yellow walls.
reviews.title: A reasonable hotel

likes.disliked: — Room was a little dirty. Location not great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was comfortable, but could have done with more of a thorough clean for my liking.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Breakfast was good and included in the cost of our room.
reviews.title: brillant staff - wonderful suite.

likes.liked: — staff and spacious suite - exceptional value for money.
likes.disliked: — too far from centre of milan.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: The location is okay - the tram stop for getting to the centre of Milan is just across the road from the hotel which was very convenient. The tram took about 25 mins to get to the historical centre from the hotel. The hotel reception sold us tickets for the tram which was handy. Having walked out of the hotel trying to find a local restaurant one evening we weren't quite sure if we were in the red-light district.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel after reading the other reviews. Firstly getting to the hotel was dificult as we followed the directions from the hotel web page, but we found out they were out of date. We tried to catch a trolley bus and was wanting the 33 as mentioned on the hotel web page. it is now the 19 or 11 that you need to catch. We ended up getting a taxi to the hotel from the Central Station which cost 15 euro. On arrival at the hotel the staff were ok, I wouldnt say over friendly as stated in some reviews. The room was very nice - modern, spacious and clean. We headed over to the shopping centre which many people mentioned in their reviews. Well worth it too. The supermarket is fab, and we had a drink at the cafe. There is a bar on the way to the supermarket which we found very reasonably priced - 2 euros for a large beer instead of the 5 euros that you would expect to pay. We were dissapointed with the breakfast. yes there was a choice. The waitresses were on the miserable side. 2 out of the 3 days they never gave us any milk for our tea and coffee so we used the milk from the cereal section. The bacon and sausage were not very good and the egg was dry. We sampled the hotel bar which is in the basement. I think it would be better located where they serve the breakfast on the 5th floor and open the doors to the terrace. However all in all it was a decent hotel. We wanted to stay alittle out of the centre, and the location was fine. We did visit the San Sero, however we caught a tram into the centre and then a tram, I think it is number 16 to the San Sero
reviews.title: It was ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although a little out of the centre, the hotel was easy accessible by public transport No's 14 & 19 from the Duomo. There is a fantastic shopping centre across the road which houses a supermarket, with almost everything on offer, including a wine bar which is located at the back of the store selling Corvo at €1.80 a glass it was incredible. So! back to the hotel.. It was quite nice, clean modern rooms, small bathroom, friendly staff. Breakfast was average, although I did get lucky one morning and found a crisply cooked bug in my portion of scrambled egg. having said that I would stay at this hotel again but would avoid the breakfast. I have stayed in many hotels in Milan over the years and would rate this one marginally above average.
reviews.title: Although a little out of the centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my husband had a fantastic stay at this hotel. We chose to stay a little out of the centre of Milan due to cost and we were pleased we found this one. It is a 5-10min ride by tram into Milan centre and the stop is directly opposite the hotel which was very convenient. You can buy your ticket from the hotel reception and it was only 3 euros's each for a day pass unlimited travel on the tram, bus and underground.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, helpful staff

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and comfortable and came with little extra's such as slippers. The bathrooms were small but looked very glitzy and posh.
reviews.title: Brilliant weekend spent at the Accademia

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, Service, Access to the city / stadium

reviews.text: Breakfast was standard but very nice. Had a good selection of fruit, cereal and yogurts and also had hams and cheeses etc. If your into a good english breakfast you wont find it here as they only provided scrambled egg, sausages and italian bacon which were ok but not fantastic.
reviews.title: Friendly Small Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed my stay at the Accademia. I found the bed comfortable as it was firm. My friend preferred a softer bed. The air conditioning was excellent considering it was 35 C when we were there. The buffet breakfast was excellent. But they did run out of eggs on the last day we were there but in all honesty we did arrive at the buffet a bit late. Spent a bit of a late night out haha. The room was very clean. The valet parking costs 20 euros a day which I found a bit high. But on the up side they did give us one day of free parking account the room we reserved was not available. So they offered us an additional room to make up for it but we did not consider it necessary so they dropped one day off the parking. The front desk spoke excellent english and were very helpful. The transportation cost is excellent. For 3 euros you can use all public transport all day. The trams are rather interested. I beleive a number of them are from the second world war and are quite loud but interesting. The thing I did not care for was the shower. It was rather bizarre in that it only had a half screen attached to the tub so if you were not very careful you got water all over the floor.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Accademia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. Very modern, clean and cool rooms!
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Although it is a little out of Milan, the transportation links were excellent, a taxi being 14 euros to the centre of Milan or the tram being 3 euros.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

likes.disliked: — Location a bit distant, but convenient trams right outside

reviews.text: Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent choice!!!
Beautiful place to stay in Milan
reviews.text: I ended up at Antares Accademia Hotel as a result of a Hotwire booking, which means I did not know specifically what hotel I would end up in. By tram, Accademia is a good twenty minutes away from Milan's Duomo. Having said this, there are two trams (# 14 and # 19) that stop precisely in front of the hotel, and they are very much on time, so it's not an arduous effort to get to the centre of Milan, if you can space the twenty minutes. Accademia is in a residential part of Milan, which means that one gets to see a slice of the city that tourists may not get exposed to. Also, I appreciated the fact that I arrived fairly early in the morning, and they checked me in without a problem, but then again I arrived on a Wednesday morning. I found some great shopping nearby down the block, which was a pleasant surprise. Overall, I would recommend the hotel.

reviews.title: Luxury
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel as we got a really good. From Stazione Centrale (train station) is about a 15 euro ride, but you can take the metro to the Duomo and then the 19 tram from there. The tram ride from the Duomo is about 15 mintues. On our arrival we were greated by very helpful staff who spoke excellent English. Our rooms we very modern and had all of the trimmings flat screen TV and the works. We noticed that the normal room rate per night was 335 which we paid for three nights. The restuarant is small and cosy, but the menu is disigned for business traveller who do not have to pay their own bills. Food was expensive and not all that good, drinks were extortionate. The only real let down was the breakfast. It started at 7am finished at 10.30am, but there was only one portion of food avaiable, so if you arrive after 9am then you are lucky to get toast. for a 4* hotel, this is not acceptable, especially at the rate they charge.

Apart from the breakfast, everything else was first class. It is not too far away from the Duomo and there are plenty of restaurants and shops in the area. A massive shopping centre over the road and a big department store on the corner.
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Money
Excellent...but beware
reviews.text: very pleased with the quality of accommodation on offer as well as the excellent service provided by everyone at the Hotel Accademia in Milan.

we stayed here for 3 nights in November after having booked directly with the hotel through their own website. we were given one of the new renovated rooms the 110 which has plasma tv screen, air conditioning, heating etc.
reviews.title: A good hotel for stag do
Simply Superb!
reviews.text: The Accademia Hotel is located very near the Fiera Milano City or Milan's Exhbiitions Centre. Nevertheless it is only a 13 euro taxi journey from central station and 8 euro from the Duomo i.e. Milan Cathedral. Apparently the San Siro football stadium is also close by but whereabouts exactly I'm not sure. This means the Accademia is great for Champions League football in Milan.

description: Hotel Accademia is member of Worldhotels First Class Collection, one of the most important and prestigious hotel chains worldwide. 66 soundproofed bedrooms including 1 suite and 2 junior suites with all modern comfort such as free Wi-Fi internet connection.From the hotel situated at the boundaries of “Area C”, Milan’s restricted traffic zone, you can reach Fieramilano Rho by car in a few minutes and by foot Fieramilanocity and Mi.Co, the new Congress Centre of Milan. The Meazza Stadium of San Siro is about 3 km far. Opposite to the Hotel there is the shopping mall "Il Portello", with over 30 designer-stores and not far from the Hotel you can reach the Arco della Pace, the Triennale Design Museum, the Torre Branca and the Castello Sforzesco. 200 meters far from the Hotel there is the base of the National Shooting Centre, where national and international events are hosted
